events.description: Are you a boy or a girl?
highlights: The kid selects the sex of the main character.

events.description: How happy are you with your classmates?
highlights: The kid is asked about his/her relationship with his current classmates.

events.description: Should you remain sit?
highlights: The kid doubts between staying sit or moving around the room.

events.description: Will you remain silent, or complain about the problem?
highlights: The kid decides if he/she shall reply to the director or remain silent.

events.description: Will you slam the door, or close normally?
highlights: The kid decides if he/she shall slam the door.

events.description: How shall you answer to mom?
highlights: The kid decides how to confront the conversation with his/her mother.

events.description: Should you argue with your mom?
highlights: The kid decides if he shall argue with her mother, after complaining about the director.

events.description: What shall you do now?
highlights: The kid arrives to his/her room, and decides what to do next.

events.description: What shall you do now?
highlights: The kid meets Kami for the first time, and does not know how to react.

events.description: (Kami) Will you accept my help?
highlights: Kami, the toy, explains to the kid that he is there to help him/her.IMPORTANT: election 2 gets the user back to the decision-making process.

events.description: Which emotion is experiencing the character after all the events occurred today?
highlights: The player is asked about how he thinks that the character felt during the day.

events.description: Should you start eating?
highlights: The kid is told to start eating breakfast, and he/she shall what to do before.
possibleChoices: Yes. We are in a hurry
First, thank mom for the breakfast

events.description: Will you kiss mom?
highlights: The kid is now on the school, and must decide if he/she gives a kiss to her mom to say goodbye.

events.description: Do you think Tom was interested in talking with you?
highlights: The main character speaks with Tom, who leaves quickly instead of conversing with you. The kid is asked about it.

events.description: How are you feeling, mate?
highlights: The main character speaks with Rob and his group, and is asked about his feelings about the fight with Ahmed the day before.
possibleChoices: I shouldn’t have fight with Ahmed

events.description: Do you feel like they try to push to you be aggressive?
highlights: After listening to Rob and his group conversation, Kami asks the main character if he feels that they try to push him/her to be aggressive.

events.description: Will you leave Ahmed alone?
highlights: The main character speaks with Rebeca, who blames him/her because of the fight of the previous day.
possibleChoices: I didn’t want to disturb both of you

events.description: Will you sit next to Rob?
highlights: The main character shall decide if he/she will sit next to Rob or not.

events.description: Will the main character be ashamed?
highlights: The professor talks about the problem that took place the day before between the main character and Ahmed.

events.description: Do you have anything to say in your defense?
highlights: The professor is discussing with Ahmed and the main character about the previous day events. He gives the main character the chance to defend him/herself.

events.description: Who will you support?
highlights: Rob is arguing with Ahmed after the main character is named his “old brother/sister”. The main character shall now decide if he/she helps Ahmed, or stays with Rob during this fight.

events.description: What do you think Tom was thinking?
highlights: In the end of chapter 2, Kami asks the main character about different people and their behavior, thoughts or emotions. The first one is Tom.
possibleChoices: Maybe that I could bully him, like with Ahmed
Maybe he was in a hurry

events.description: Why do you think Rebeca was angry with you?
highlights: In the end of chapter 2, Kami asks the main character about different people and their behavior, thoughts or emotions. The second one is Rebeca.
possibleChoices: I suppose is because I bullied Ahmed
She is jealous of my group

events.description: Why do you think mom kept distance with you all the day?
highlights: At the end of chapter 2, Kami asks the main character about different people and their behavior, thoughts or emotions. The last one is Mom.
possibleChoices: She may be sad because of dad’s death
Maybe she is still angry because of me
She’s probably having a bad day

events.description: Do you think Rob is worried?
highlights: After listening to Rob and his group conversation, Kami asks the main character if he thinks Rob is worried about your discussion with mom.

events.description: Why did you change your opinion about the fight yesterday?
highlights: After listening to Rob and his group conversation, Kami asks the main character why did he change its opinion about the fight with Ahmed.
possibleChoices: Due to the argument with mom
Due to the argument with the director

events.description: Do you think this advice can be useful?
highlights: At the beginning of chapter 3, the main character thinks about what Kami said the night before.

events.description: Shall I wait for mom?
highlights: At the beginning of chapter 3, the main character walks down to eat breakfast. However, he/she can’t see mom anywhere.

events.description: How do you think mom is feeling right now?
highlights: Kami points out that mom is outside, and he asks the main character about her feelings.

events.description: How do you think mom is feeling right now?
highlights: When looking for mom, the main character founds her at the backyard. Kami  asks the main character about her feelings.

events.description: What would you say to Mike?
highlights: When arriving to school, Mike apologies for his behavior with you.
possibleChoices: I won’t forgive you. You could have supported me

events.description: How should you answer?
highlights: When the main character meets Ahmed, the last greets him with an Islamic term, “Salam Alaikum”. How should the main character answer?.
possibleChoices: I didn’t know that term. What does it mean?

events.description: How should you answer?
highlights: When you ask Ahmed about the meaning of that expression, the main character has the chance to say it back or not.

events.description: How does Ahmed feel right now?
highlights: Once the main character tries to answer Ahmed using his language, he changes his expression. The player shall identify the emotion.

events.description: How would you feel if you were accused of getting into troubles on Ahmed’s condition?
highlights: After seeing the argument between Ahmed and Kong, the main character gets involved into another argument with Ahmed, who finally leaves the scene. Then, Kami makes the main character wonder how does Ahmed feels about being constantly bullied.
possibleChoices: I think I didn’t do anything bad
Maybe I should had stopped before

events.description: Check Tom’s expression. Why is he so evasive with you?
highlights: The main character starts a conversation with Tom, and is questioned about what Tom feels watching his expression.

events.description: How should you answer Tom?
highlights: The main character starts a conversation with Tom, and he decides how to answer Tom.
possibleChoices: Why don’t you stop this attitude?
Calm down, Tom. I don’t want to bother you

events.description: How is Ahmed feeling right now?
highlights: The main character arrives outside in time to see how his/her friends are throwing a ball, without letting Ahmed to play. The player shall first try to understand how Ahmed is feeling on this situation.

events.description: Should you try to include Ahmed in the game?
highlights: The main character arrives outside in time to see how his/her friends are throwing a ball, without letting Ahmed to play. Now, the player must decide if he shall try to include Ahmed in the game, or leave the scene to avoid problems.
possibleChoices: Leave the scene with Ahmed, to avoid problems

events.description: How is Rob feeling right now?
highlights: After starting to play with the Ahmed and Rob’s group, you throw the ball so Ahmed can catch it. Rob then starts feeling angry. The player must identify this emotion.

events.description: What do you think that you should do now?
highlights: The third time he receives the ball, the main character shall decide if he is going to throw the ball to Ahmed again, challenging Rob, or if Rob is right.
possibleChoices: Challenge Rob. Ahmed should be included

events.description: The questions are:
highlights: The main character shall decide if he tells the whole problem with Rob to the professor.

events.description: How do you think that Ahmed felt after all the recess problem?
highlights: Kami and the main character maintain a final talk on the backyard. Kami asks the player how does he think that Ahmed felt after the recess scene.

events.description: How do you feel after helping Ahmed?
highlights: Kami and the main character maintain a final talk on the backyard. Kami asks the player how did he/she felt when helping Ahmed.
possibleChoices: Sad. I don’t like to argue with my friends

events.description: How do you manage stress?
highlights: The player is questioned about how he manages the stress.
possibleChoices: I breathe deeply and try to calm down
I look for someone to help me
Nothing, I don’t usually lose my temper

events.description: Who will you choose as bus companion?
highlights: The player shall decide who to sit with.

events.description: Did the player won the game?
highlights: The player participates in the first breathing game.

events.description: Why do you seem nervous?
highlights: The player is questioned by Kami about his nerves.
possibleChoices: Because of what happened yesterday during recess
Is just due to the game

events.description: How do you call this effect?
highlights: If you are trembling, that’s a mirror of your emotions. How do we call this?.

events.description: Which emotion do you think Ahmed felt during the dream?
highlights: The player is questioned about how he thinks Ahmed felt during the dream.

events.description: Why do you think Ahmed had a nightmare?
highlights: The main character discuss with Kami about the reasons why Ahmed had a nightmare.
possibleChoices: Maybe he is not confident when he is away from home
Maybe he is still scared of me
Well... I saw Kong talking with him at the school bathroom

events.description: What do you think that you should do with Ahmed?
highlights: The main character is questioned about what should he do with Ahmed.

events.description: Do you believe Elle?
highlights: Elle tries to deceive the main character, telling him that Ahmed wants to speak with Kong. The player shall decide if he believes it or not.

events.description: Are you going to ask me if I try to get into troubles with Kong?
highlights: Ahmed asks if the player thinks that he is trying to get into troubles with Kong.
possibleChoices: Yes, you need to be more careful

events.description: How difficult was the boat game?
highlights: The main character is asked to score the difficulty of the boat game.

events.description: What shall you do first?
highlights: Rebeca asks Ahmed about the order of the body parts for relaxation. This is the first question.

events.description: What shall you do next?
highlights: Rebeca asks Ahmed about the order of the body parts for relaxation. This is the second question.

highlights: Rebeca asks Ahmed about the order of the body parts for relaxation. This is the third question.

highlights: Rebeca asks Ahmed about the order of the body parts for relaxation. This is the fourth question.

highlights: Rebeca asks Ahmed about the order of the body parts for relaxation. This is the seventh question.

events.description: What shall you do next?
highlights: Rebeca asks Ahmed about the order of the body parts for relaxation. This is the final question.

events.description: Do you think they are a bad influence for you?
highlights: Rebeca thinks that Rob and the others are a bad influence for you. Do you think so?.

events.description: Do you think Rob influenced you?
highlights: Rebeca thinks that the players bad behaviour was influenced by Rob.

events.description: Which is the first strategy you learnt?
highlights: Ahmed experiences a new nightmare, and has to confront it with the strategies he has learnt during the last days. What shall he do before?.

events.description: Which is the second strategy you learnt?
highlights: Ahmed experiences a new nightmare, and has to confront it with the strategies he has learnt during the last days. What shall he do as a second step?.

events.description: What shall you do first?
highlights: Ahmed needs to apply relaxation techniques while he is inside the nightmare. This is the first step.

events.description: What shall you do next?
highlights: Ahmed needs to apply relaxation techniques while he is inside the nightmare. This is the second step.

events.description: What shall you do next?
highlights: Ahmed needs to apply relaxation techniques while he is inside the nightmare. This is the third step.

events.description: What shall you do next?
highlights: Ahmed needs to apply relaxation techniques while he is inside the nightmare. This is the fourth step.

events.description: What shall you do next?
highlights: Ahmed needs to apply relaxation techniques while he is inside the nightmare. This is the fifth step.

possibleChoices: Relax the rest of the body

highlights: Ahmed needs to apply relaxation techniques while he is inside the nightmare. This is the seventh step.

events.description: What shall you do next?
highlights: Ahmed needs to apply relaxation techniques while he is inside the nightmare. This is the final step.

events.description: During the second nightmare, Ahmed needs to use his breath to end up with Kong. If he breathes too early, Kong goes back, and it is count as 1 fail (this variable += 1)
highlights: The less this value scores, the better the player performed.

events.description: What shall you do with the cat?
highlights: Kami is being pursued by the cat. The main character helps him capturing the cat, but he/she shall decide what to do with the cat.

events.description: What shall you answer to Kami?
highlights: Kami and the main character are back in the room. Kami says that the main character would have done the same with the cat.
possibleChoices: You said that we shall be kind with others
My mom could hear us with the cat. Be careful next time!

events.description: Do you remember what is the current job of Ahmed’s father?
highlights: Kami uses the example of a conversation between Ahmed and the main character to explain what the active listening is.
possibleChoices: He works in a pie shop
It does not have any relevance

events.description: Do you think that you and your mother listened actively to each other?
highlights: Kami uses the example of a conversation between mom and the main character to explain what the active listening is.

events.description: Will you follow the conversation?
highlights: The main character starts talking with his/her mother. After the first question, the main character shall decide if he/she is going to continue with the conversation.

events.description: Will you follow the conversation?
highlights: The main character starts talking with his/her mother. After the second question, the main character shall decide if he/she is going to continue with the conversation.
possibleChoices: Would you like to tell me more?
Ok, I don’t want to disturb you

events.description: Will you follow the conversation?
highlights: The main character starts talking with his/her mother. After the third question, the main character shall decide if he/she is going to continue with the conversation.

events.description: What will you answer?
highlights: The main character starts talking with his/her mother. After the fourth question, in this case related with his/her dad’s death, the main character shall decide how is he going to end the conversation.
possibleChoices: If it helps you feel more comfortable, I can go with you
I understand you. It makes me feel bad too

events.description: Do you think that Kami’s advice is useful to solve this kind of conflicts?
highlights: The main character is questioned about the usefulness of Kami’s advice to resolve conflicts like the one he/she has with his/her mother.

events.description: What do you think about horse riding?
highlights: The main character shall talk with 5 different partners to try his/her active listening skills. In this case, the questions are directed to Ana, while she says that she likes horses.
possibleChoices: It is a very beautiful sport
Horses are a waste of time

events.description: Which member of Ana’s family decided to teach him to ride horses?
highlights: The main character shall talk with 5 different partners to try his/her active listening skills. In this case, the questions are directed to Ana.

events.description: How do you think Tom is feeling?
highlights: The main character shall talk with 5 different partners to try his/her active listening skills. In this case, the questions are directed to Tom.

events.description: Do you understand how Tom is feeling about your previous behavior?
highlights: The main character shall talk with 5 different partners to try his/her active listening skills. In this case, the questions are directed to Tom.
possibleChoices: I understand how are you feeling

events.description: Do you understand why Tom behaved like that before?
highlights: The main character shall talk with 5 different partners to try his/her active listening skills. In this case, the questions are directed to Tom. Kami asks the main character if he/she understands how Tom is feeling.
possibleChoices: Yes. I understand how he is feeling
No. I think he is exaggerating

events.description: Do you think Antonio is listening to you?
highlights: The main character shall talk with 5 different partners to try his/her active listening skills. In this case, the questions are directed to Antonio. But he starts talking about completely different topics, so the main character must understand that he is now listening him/her.

events.description: Which is the favorite subject of Antonio?
highlights: The main character shall talk with 5 different partners to try his/her active listening skills. In this case, the questions are directed to Antonio. Now, the main character has to answer regarding Antonio’s preferences.

events.description: Will you insist?
highlights: The main character shall talk with 5 different partners to try his/her active listening skills. In this case, the questions are directed to Rebeca. The main character asks her about Ahmed, but she prefers not to talk. The main character must decide if insisting or not.

events.description: Will you keep insisting?
highlights: The main character shall talk with 5 different partners to try his/her active listening skills. In this case, the questions are directed to Rebeca. The main character asks her about Ahmed, but she prefers not to talk. The main character insists, but she doesn’t want to talk. What to do next?.

events.description: Which animals did Lori said, and on which order?
highlights: The main character shall talk with 5 different partners to try his/her active listening skills. In this case, the questions are directed to Lori.

events.description: How many questions has the player answered correctly.
highlights: Summary of correct answers during the active listening game.

events.description: Who were you talking with?
highlights: After the questions, Ahmed arrives, and he asks the main character who is he/she talking with.
possibleChoices: With my toy Kami. He is helping me behave properly

events.description: What do you think? Should the group include Mike?
highlights: Mike comes to Ahmed, Rebeca and the main character to ask them to participate with the group.
possibleChoices: Rebeca is right. Mike should leave

events.description: What do you think?
highlights: After denying the help, Ahmed justifies why does he think Mike should stay. The main character shall decide again.
possibleChoices: If we kick him out, we will be like Rob
If he apologies, he can stay
I still think is not a good idea

events.description: Do you remember what is to listen actively?
highlights: The chapter starts asking the player if he remembers what is to listen actively.
possibleChoices: It implies remaining quiet when the other speaks
It implies listening and asking questions

events.description: How would Tom answer to Martin?
highlights: The player plays the role of Tom, as he has to deal with different social situations acting as he thinks Tom would act. The first decision is related with Martin, surprisingly appearing behind the player. The decision involves how the character greets someone.

events.description: How would Tom answer to Lori?
highlights: The player plays the role of Tom, as he has to deal with different social situations acting as he thinks Tom would act. The second decision is related with Lori, who asks the player about his opinion of Antonio’s clothes. The decision involves how the character praise someone.

events.description: How would Tom ask Rebeca to let him pass?
highlights: The player plays the role of Tom, as he has to deal with different social situations acting as he thinks Tom would act. The third decision is related with Rebeca, who is blocking the way. The decision involves how the character asks things.
possibleChoices: Hi Rebeca! Could you please let me pass?

events.description: How would Tom answer Kong and Lori insults?
highlights: The player plays the role of Tom, as he has to deal with different social situations acting as he thinks Tom would act. The forth decision is related with Lori and Kong, who are messing with him. The decision involves how the character deals with a problem.
possibleChoices: Well… I… don’t want to… have a problem with you
Let me alone. Don’t you have anything better to do?
You look like a whole circus, Kong

events.description: Do you think Tom would accept the critic without complaining?
highlights: The player plays the role of Tom, as he has to deal with different social situations acting as he thinks Tom would act. The fifth decision is related with the teacher, who unfairly accuses Tom of being late. The decision involves how the character deals with criticism.

events.description: Why?
highlights: After saying “yes” to the first question, the player justifies why he thinks Tom would accept without complaining.

events.description: Why?
highlights: After saying “no” to the first question, the player justifies why he thinks Tom would accept without complaining.
possibleChoices: He know it isn’t his fault
He does not like to be criticize in public

events.description: How would Rob answer to Martin?
highlights: The player plays the role of Rob, as he has to deal with different social situations acting as he thinks Rob would act. The first decision is related with Martin, surprisingly appearing behind the player. The decision involves how the character greets someone.

events.description: How would Rob answer to Lori?
highlights: The player plays the role of Rob, as he has to deal with different social situations acting as he thinks Rob would act. The second decision is related with Lori, who asks the player about his opinion of Antonio’s clothes. The decision involves how the character praise someone.

events.description: How would Rob ask Rebeca to let him pass?

possibleChoices: Hi Rebeca! Could you please let me pass?

events.description: How would Rob answer Kong and Lori insults?
highlights: The player plays the role of Rob, as he has to deal with different social situations acting as he thinks Rob would act. The forth decision is related with Lori and Kong, who are messing with him. The decision involves how the character deals with a problem.
possibleChoices: Well… I… don’t want to… have a problem with you
Let me alone. Don’t you have anything better to do?
You look like a whole circus, Kong

events.description: Do you think Rob would accept the critic without complaining?
highlights: The player plays the role of Rob, as he has to deal with different social situations acting as he thinks Rob would act. The fifth decision is related with the teacher, who unfairly accuses Rob of being late. The decision involves how the character deals with criticism.

events.description: Why
highlights: After saying “yes” to the first question, the player justifies why he thinks Rob would accept without complaining.

events.description: Why
highlights: After saying “no” to the first question, the player justifies why he thinks Rob would accept without complaining.
possibleChoices: He know it isn’t his fault
He does not like to be criticize in public

highlights: While waiting for Mike, Rebeca asks the main character about Ahmed’s mother.
possibleChoices: She is engineer, but works as backer
Baker, but she works as engineer

events.description: How will you greet Ahmed?
highlights: Once arrived to Ahmed’s house, the main character decides how to greet him.

events.description: What is exactly the pillar of fasting?
highlights: When remembering his past, Ahmed talks about the Mosque and how did he learnt there about the Islam principles. The imam asks him about the pillar of fasting.
possibleChoices: The fasting during all mornings of the year

events.description: What is the “Mecca”?
highlights: When remembering his past, Ahmed talks about the Mosque and how did he learnt there about the Islam principles. Second, the imam asks him about the Mecca.
possibleChoices: The name of the mandatory payment

events.description: How many times shall a Muslim pray per day?
highlights: When remembering his past, Ahmed talks about the Mosque and how did he learnt there about the Islam principles. Third, the imam asks Ahmed how many times shall he pray per day.

events.description: Which is a holy book for Muslims?
highlights: When remembering his past, Ahmed talks about the Mosque and how did he learnt there about the Islam principles. Finally, the imam asks Ahmed about the Quran.

events.description: Why do you think Mike has apologize?
highlights: After listening to Ahmed’s story, Mike apologizes to Ahmed. This is the reason that the player uses to justify it.
possibleChoices: Because of your past behavior with Ahmed
Because he is sorry about what happened to his city
Because you don’t have more baklavas

events.description: How do you think Ahmed is?
highlights: The player has to define the interpersonal style of Ahmed.

events.description: How do you think Mike is?
highlights: The player has to define the interpersonal style of Mike.

highlights: The player has to define the interpersonal style of the main character.

highlights: The player has to define the interpersonal style of the second person that denies their solicitude.

events.description: How do you think this type of person was?
highlights: The player has to define the interpersonal style of the third person that denies their solicitude.

events.description: What do you think the main character thinks?
highlights: After hearing the exposition of the team, the teacher asks them questions about the story to find out if they truly paid attention to the whole content. The main character begins to feel nervous.
possibleChoices: Come on, it can be that bad
I’ Come on, it can be that bad me really anxious when I have to speak in public

events.description: How is named the place where Ahmed went to pray on his town?
highlights: After hearing the exposition of the team, the teacher asks them questions about the story to find out if they truly paid attention to the whole content. The first question is about the Mosque.

events.description: How many rules has Ahmed’s religion?
highlights: After hearing the exposition of the team, the teacher asks them questions about the story to find out if they truly paid attention to the whole content. The second question is related with the pillars of Islam.

events.description: How many questions has the player answered correctly?
highlights: Summary of correct answers during the questions to the team.

events.description: What do you think Ahmed was feeling?
highlights: After telling Ahmed that Rob has proposed you to come back to the group, he leaves the room. The main character must identify his face to understand what he feels.

events.description: How do you feel about this problem?
highlights: After identifying the problem, the main character express how he feels about it.
possibleChoices: It pisses me that he behaves like that, after all this time
I think I understand how he feels
He could be happy for me, instead of only thinking about himself

events.description: What are you going to do now?
highlights: After identifying the problem, the main character shall decide what to do next.

events.description: What should you do?
highlights: Ahmed tries to stop the conversation about the problem. The main character must decide if he wants to show interest on the conversation.
possibleChoices: Stop the conversation. It doesn’t matter

possibleChoices: I’m in a hurry, I can’t talk now! Sorry!

highlights: The chapter begins with Kami asking you what should you tell yourself to escape from a toxic thinking.

highlights: The chapter begins with Kami asking which kind of sentence would you needf to escape from a toxic thinking.

Why should I accept that he treats me like that?

events.description: What kind of sentence would you need?
highlights: The second question asked by Kami is related with which type of self-instruction would have been useful to avoid a problem with Ahmed.

highlights: The third question asked by Kami is related with which type of self-instruction would have been useful to avoid getting nervous on classroom.

highlights: The forth question asked by Kami is related with which type of self-instruction would have been useful to avoid getting nervous on classroom.

highlights: The player is asked about how he thinks Rebeca is feeling.

highlights: The player shall answer why he thinks Ahmed was angry.

He knew you were going to punch him
Because you keep talking with Rob

events.description: Who did Ahmed talked to?
highlights: The player shall answer who did Ahmed talked to about this problem.

events.description: What was Rob’s intention?
highlights: The player doubts about Rob’s reason to ask him to get back to his group.
possibleChoices: To have a good relationship with Ahmed
To confront the main character and Ahmed

events.description: Do you think Mike’s idea is correct?
highlights: The player doubts about how to confront Rob. Mike gives his opinion.

events.description: Do you think Ahmed’s idea is correct?
highlights: The player doubts about how to confront Rob. Ahmed gives his opinion.

events.description: Do you think Rebeca’s idea is correct?
highlights: The player doubts about how to confront Rob. Rebeca gives his opinion.

events.description: Do you think Rob is assertive, shy or aggressive?
highlights: The player is asked to identify the social style of a person.

events.description: Do you think Elle is assertive, shy or aggressive?
highlights: The player is asked to identify the social style of a person.

events.description: Do you think Kong is assertive, shy or aggressive?
highlights: The player is asked to identify the social style of a person.

events.description: What shall you do?
highlights: The main character must decide what to do. If he/she goes back with Rob, stays with the new group, or stays with both of them.

events.description: First breathing game, on which the player must move the character according to the breathing rhythm. If he moves it too early, the character goes back, and it is count as 1 fail (this variable += 1)
highlights: The less this value scores, the better the player performed

events.description: During his nightmare, Ahmed needs to use his breath to control his movements, in order to be silent enough to stay hide. If he moves it too early, the character goes back, and it is count as 1 fail (this variable += 1)
highlights: The less this value scores, the better the player performed.

events.description: The main character explains Ahmed how to control his breath, using a boat moving as an example. If he moves it too early, the character goes back, and it is count as 1 fail (this variable += 1)
highlights: The less this value scores, the better the player performed.

events.description: The main character plays on which he has to inflate a balloon until it reaches the sky. If he breathes too early, the balloon goes back, and it is count as 1 fail (this variable += 1)
highlights: The less this value scores, the better the player performed.

events.description: During the second nightmare, Ahmed needs to use his breath to control his movements, in order to be silent enough to stay hide. If he moves it too early, the character goes back, and it is count as 1 fail (this variable += 1)
highlights: The less this value scores, the better the player performed.
